physDesc.additional: Script: 'bru tsha. Lines per folio: 6; 5 on fol. 8a. Number on last folio: brgyad bzhugs so Orthography: - Numerals used for numbers - Frequent abbreviations (e.g., for thams cad, nyon mongs, etc.) - Frequent additional suffix –‘a (e.g., dbye’, brda’, gzhi’) - Bindu for m - Always a tsheg before shad (or double shad) Proofread (zhus btugs)

body.ab: 'phags pa bsdud pa'i bsdus don bzhugs s+ho ||

shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa bsdud pa tshigs su bcad pa la spyi don 3 ste | de nas mdo 'byung
pa'i rgyu phun sum 'tshogs pa dang | gsungs pa mdo'i rang bzhin phun sum 'tshogs pa dang | ming ni rang bzhin can gyi mtshan phun sum 'tshogs pa'o ||

shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa mdo rkyang du
bshad pa'i don yang dag par bsdus pa'o || shag kya'i dge slong brtson 'grus seng ges sbyar ba'o || zhus btugs so || rdzogs s+ho || thugs rje rgyal gyis bris lha rje chos rin thugs dgyes par zhu'o || ||A correct summary of the meanings explained in the Prajñāpāramitā sañcayagāthā alone. Composed by the Śākya monk brtson 'grus seng ge. ‹It was corrected›. Completed. ‹Written by Thugs rje rgyal, May lHa rje chos rin be delighted!›
